trans-unit.source: Monitor availability and responsiveness of any web site | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Monitor availability and responsiveness of any web site | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Set up web tests in Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Set up web tests in Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Get alerts if a website becomes unavailable or responds slowly.
trans-unit.target: Get alerts if a website becomes unavailable or responds slowly.

trans-unit.source: Monitor availability and responsiveness of any web site
trans-unit.target: Monitor availability and responsiveness of any web site

trans-unit.source: After you've deployed your web application, you can set up web tests to monitor its availability and responsiveness.
trans-unit.target: After you've deployed your web application, you can set up web tests to monitor its availability and responsiveness.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights will send web requests at regular intervals from points around the world, and can alert you if your application responds slowly or not at all.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights will send web requests at regular intervals from points around the world, and can alert you if your application responds slowly or not at all.

trans-unit.source: Web test example
trans-unit.target: Web test example

trans-unit.source: You can set up web tests for any HTTP endpoint that is accessible from the public internet.
trans-unit.target: You can set up web tests for any HTTP endpoint that is accessible from the public internet.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of web test:
trans-unit.target: There are two types of web test:

trans-unit.source: [URL ping test](#set-up-a-url-ping-test): a simple test that you can create in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: [URL ping test](#set-up-a-url-ping-test): a simple test that you can create in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: [Multi-step web test](#multi-step-web-tests): which you create in Visual Studio Ultimate or Visual Studio Enterprise and upload to the portal.
trans-unit.target: [Multi-step web test](#multi-step-web-tests): which you create in Visual Studio Ultimate or Visual Studio Enterprise and upload to the portal.

trans-unit.source: Set up a URL ping test
trans-unit.target: Set up a URL ping test

trans-unit.source: 1. Create a new resource?
trans-unit.target: 1. Create a new resource?

trans-unit.source: Skip this step if you've already [set up an Application Insights resource][start] for this application, and you want to see the availability data in the same place.
trans-unit.target: Skip this step if you've already [set up an Application Insights resource][start] for this application, and you want to see the availability data in the same place.

trans-unit.source: Sign up to [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com), go to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), and create a new Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: Sign up to [Microsoft Azure](http://azure.com), go to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), and create a new Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: New > Application Insights
trans-unit.target: New > Application Insights

trans-unit.source: The Overview blade for the new resource will open.
trans-unit.target: The Overview blade for the new resource will open.

trans-unit.source: To find this at any time in the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), click **Browse**.
trans-unit.target: To find this at any time in the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), click **Browse**.

trans-unit.source: 2. Create a web test
trans-unit.target: 2. Create a web test

trans-unit.source: In your Application Insights resource, look for the Availability tile.
trans-unit.target: In your Application Insights resource, look for the Availability tile.

trans-unit.source: Click it to open the Web tests blade for your application, and add a web test.
trans-unit.target: Click it to open the Web tests blade for your application, and add a web test.

trans-unit.source: Fill at least the URL of your website
trans-unit.target: Fill at least the URL of your website

trans-unit.source: **The URL** must be visible from the public internet.
trans-unit.target: **The URL** must be visible from the public internet.

trans-unit.source: It can include a query string—so, for example, you can exercise your database a little.
trans-unit.target: It can include a query string—so, for example, you can exercise your database a little.

trans-unit.source: If the URL resolves to a redirect, we will follow it up to 10 redirects.
trans-unit.target: If the URL resolves to a redirect, we will follow it up to 10 redirects.

trans-unit.source: If **Enable retries** is selected, then when the test fails, it is retried after a short interval.
trans-unit.target: If **Enable retries** is selected, then when the test fails, it is retried after a short interval.

trans-unit.source: A failure is reported only if three successive attempts fail.
trans-unit.target: A failure is reported only if three successive attempts fail.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent tests are then performed at the usual interval.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent tests are then performed at the usual interval.

trans-unit.source: Retry is temporarily suspended until the next success.
trans-unit.target: Retry is temporarily suspended until the next success.

trans-unit.source: This rule is applied independently at each test location.
trans-unit.target: This rule is applied independently at each test location.

trans-unit.source: **Test locations** are the places from where our servers send web requests to your URL.
trans-unit.target: **Test locations** are the places from where our servers send web requests to your URL.

trans-unit.source: Choose more than one so that you can distinguish problems in your website from network issues.
trans-unit.target: Choose more than one so that you can distinguish problems in your website from network issues.

trans-unit.source: You can select up to 16 locations.
trans-unit.target: You can select up to 16 locations.

trans-unit.source: **Success criteria**:
trans-unit.target: **Success criteria**:

trans-unit.source: **HTTP status code**: 200 is usual.
trans-unit.target: **HTTP status code**: 200 is usual.

trans-unit.source: **Content match**: a string, like "Welcome!"
trans-unit.target: **Content match**: a string, like "Welcome!"

trans-unit.source: We'll test that it occurs in every response.
trans-unit.target: We'll test that it occurs in every response.

trans-unit.source: It must be a plain string, without wildcards.
trans-unit.target: It must be a plain string, without wildcards.

trans-unit.source: Don't forget that if your page content changes you might have to update it.
trans-unit.target: Don't forget that if your page content changes you might have to update it.

trans-unit.source: **Alerts** are, by default, sent to you if there are repeated failures over 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: **Alerts** are, by default, sent to you if there are repeated failures over 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: But you can change it to be more or less sensitive, and you can also change the notified email addresses.
trans-unit.target: But you can change it to be more or less sensitive, and you can also change the notified email addresses.

trans-unit.source: Test more URLs
trans-unit.target: Test more URLs

trans-unit.source: Add more tests.
trans-unit.target: Add more tests.

trans-unit.source: For example, as well as testing your home page, you can make sure your database is running by testing the URL for a search.
trans-unit.target: For example, as well as testing your home page, you can make sure your database is running by testing the URL for a search.

trans-unit.source: 3. View availability reports
trans-unit.target: 3. View availability reports

trans-unit.source: After 1-2 minutes, click **Refresh** on the availability/web tests blade.
trans-unit.target: After 1-2 minutes, click **Refresh** on the availability/web tests blade.

trans-unit.source: (It doesn't refresh automatically.)
trans-unit.target: (It doesn't refresh automatically.)

trans-unit.source: Summary results on the home blade
trans-unit.target: Summary results on the home blade

trans-unit.source: Click any bar on the summary chart at the top for a more detailed view of that time period.
trans-unit.target: Click any bar on the summary chart at the top for a more detailed view of that time period.

trans-unit.source: These charts combine results for all the web tests of this application.
trans-unit.target: These charts combine results for all the web tests of this application.

trans-unit.source: Components of your web page
trans-unit.target: Components of your web page

trans-unit.source: Images, style sheets and scripts and other static components of the web page you're testing are requested as part of the test.
trans-unit.target: Images, style sheets and scripts and other static components of the web page you're testing are requested as part of the test.

trans-unit.source: The recorded response time is the time taken for all the components to complete loading.
trans-unit.target: The recorded response time is the time taken for all the components to complete loading.

trans-unit.source: If any component fails to load, the test is marked failed.
trans-unit.target: If any component fails to load, the test is marked failed.

trans-unit.source: If you see failures...
trans-unit.target: If you see failures...

trans-unit.source: Click a red dot.
trans-unit.target: Click a red dot.

trans-unit.source: Click a red dot
trans-unit.target: Click a red dot

trans-unit.source: Or, scroll down and click a test where you see less than 100% success.
trans-unit.target: Or, scroll down and click a test where you see less than 100% success.

trans-unit.source: Click a specific webtest
trans-unit.target: Click a specific webtest

trans-unit.source: This shows you the results for that test.
trans-unit.target: This shows you the results for that test.

trans-unit.source: Click a specific webtest
trans-unit.target: Click a specific webtest

trans-unit.source: The test is run from several locations—pick one where the results are less than 100%.
trans-unit.target: The test is run from several locations—pick one where the results are less than 100%.

trans-unit.source: Click a specific webtest
trans-unit.target: Click a specific webtest

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to **Failed tests** and pick a result.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to **Failed tests** and pick a result.

trans-unit.source: Click the result to evaluate it in the portal and see why it failed.
trans-unit.target: Click the result to evaluate it in the portal and see why it failed.

trans-unit.source: Webtest run result
trans-unit.target: Webtest run result

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can download the result file and inspect it in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can download the result file and inspect it in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: *Looks OK but reported as a failure?* Check all the images, scripts, style sheets and any other files loaded by the page.
trans-unit.target: *Looks OK but reported as a failure?* Check all the images, scripts, style sheets and any other files loaded by the page.

trans-unit.source: If any of them fails, the test will be reported as failed, even if the main html page loads OK.
trans-unit.target: If any of them fails, the test will be reported as failed, even if the main html page loads OK.

trans-unit.source: Multi-step web tests
trans-unit.target: Multi-step web tests

trans-unit.source: You can monitor a scenario that involves a sequence of URLs.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor a scenario that involves a sequence of URLs.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you are monitoring a sales website, you can test that adding items to the shopping cart works correctly.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you are monitoring a sales website, you can test that adding items to the shopping cart works correctly.

trans-unit.source: To create a multi-step test, you record the scenario by using Visual Studio, and then upload the recording to Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: To create a multi-step test, you record the scenario by using Visual Studio, and then upload the recording to Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights will replay the scenario at intervals and verify the responses.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights will replay the scenario at intervals and verify the responses.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can't use coded functions in your tests: the scenario steps must be contained as a script in the .webtest file.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can't use coded functions in your tests: the scenario steps must be contained as a script in the .webtest file.

trans-unit.source: 1. Record a scenario
trans-unit.target: 1. Record a scenario

trans-unit.source: Use Visual Studio Ultimate to record a web session.
trans-unit.target: Use Visual Studio Ultimate to record a web session.

trans-unit.source: Create a web performance test project.
trans-unit.target: Create a web performance test project.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, create a new project from the Web Performance and Load Test template.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, create a new project from the Web Performance and Load Test template.

trans-unit.source: Open the .webtest file and start recording.
trans-unit.target: Open the .webtest file and start recording.

trans-unit.source: Open the .webtest file and click Record.
trans-unit.target: Open the .webtest file and click Record.

trans-unit.source: Do the user actions you want to simulate in your test: open your website, add a product to the cart, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Do the user actions you want to simulate in your test: open your website, add a product to the cart, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Then stop your test.
trans-unit.target: Then stop your test.

trans-unit.source: The web test recorder runs in Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The web test recorder runs in Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Don't make a long scenario.
trans-unit.target: Don't make a long scenario.

trans-unit.source: There's a limit of 100 steps and 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: There's a limit of 100 steps and 2 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Run the test in Visual Studio to make sure it works.
trans-unit.target: Run the test in Visual Studio to make sure it works.

trans-unit.source: The web test runner opens a web browser and repeats the actions you recorded.
trans-unit.target: The web test runner opens a web browser and repeats the actions you recorded.

trans-unit.source: Make sure it works as you expect.
trans-unit.target: Make sure it works as you expect.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the .webtest file and click Run.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the .webtest file and click Run.

trans-unit.source: (Don't insert loops in your web test.)
trans-unit.target: (Don't insert loops in your web test.)

trans-unit.source: 2. Upload the web test to Application Insights
trans-unit.target: 2. Upload the web test to Application Insights

trans-unit.source: In the Application Insights portal, create a new web test.
trans-unit.target: In the Application Insights portal, create a new web test.

trans-unit.source: On the web tests blade, choose Add.
trans-unit.target: On the web tests blade, choose Add.

trans-unit.source: Select multi-step test, and upload the .webtest file.
trans-unit.target: Select multi-step test, and upload the .webtest file.

trans-unit.source: Select multi-step webtest.
trans-unit.target: Select multi-step webtest.

trans-unit.source: View your test results and any failures in the same way as for single-url tests.
trans-unit.target: View your test results and any failures in the same way as for single-url tests.

trans-unit.source: A common reason for failure is that the test runs too long.
trans-unit.target: A common reason for failure is that the test runs too long.

trans-unit.source: It mustn't run longer than two minutes.
trans-unit.target: It mustn't run longer than two minutes.

trans-unit.source: Don't forget that all the resources of a page must load correctly for the test to succeed, including scripts, style sheets, images and so forth.
trans-unit.target: Don't forget that all the resources of a page must load correctly for the test to succeed, including scripts, style sheets, images and so forth.

trans-unit.source: Note that the web test must be entirely contained in the .webtest file: you can't use coded functions in the test.
trans-unit.target: Note that the web test must be entirely contained in the .webtest file: you can't use coded functions in the test.

trans-unit.source: Plugging time and random numbers into your multi-step test
trans-unit.target: Plugging time and random numbers into your multi-step test

trans-unit.source: Suppose you're testing a tool that gets time-dependent data such as stocks from an external feed.
trans-unit.target: Suppose you're testing a tool that gets time-dependent data such as stocks from an external feed.

trans-unit.source: When you record your web test, you have to use specific times, but you set them as parameters of the test, StartTime and EndTime.
trans-unit.target: When you record your web test, you have to use specific times, but you set them as parameters of the test, StartTime and EndTime.

trans-unit.source: A web test with parameters.
trans-unit.target: A web test with parameters.

trans-unit.source: When you run the test, you'd like EndTime always to be the present time, and StartTime should be 15 minutes ago.
trans-unit.target: When you run the test, you'd like EndTime always to be the present time, and StartTime should be 15 minutes ago.

trans-unit.source: Web Test Plug-ins provide the way to do this.
trans-unit.target: Web Test Plug-ins provide the way to do this.

trans-unit.source: Add a web test plug-in for each variable parameter value you want.
trans-unit.target: Add a web test plug-in for each variable parameter value you want.

trans-unit.source: In the web test toolbar, choose **Add Web Test Plugin**.
trans-unit.target: In the web test toolbar, choose **Add Web Test Plugin**.

trans-unit.source: Choose Add Web Test Plugin and select a type.
trans-unit.target: Choose Add Web Test Plugin and select a type.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we'll use two instances of the Date Time Plug-in.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we'll use two instances of the Date Time Plug-in.

trans-unit.source: One instance is for "15 minutes ago" and another for "now".
trans-unit.target: One instance is for "15 minutes ago" and another for "now".

trans-unit.source: Open the properties of each plug-in.
trans-unit.target: Open the properties of each plug-in.

trans-unit.source: Give it a name and set it to use the current time.
trans-unit.target: Give it a name and set it to use the current time.

trans-unit.source: For one of them, set Add Minutes = -15.
trans-unit.target: For one of them, set Add Minutes = -15.

trans-unit.source: Set name, Use Current Time, and Add Minutes.
trans-unit.target: Set name, Use Current Time, and Add Minutes.

trans-unit.source: In the web test parameters, use {{plug-in name}} to reference a plug-in name.
trans-unit.target: In the web test parameters, use {{plug-in name}} to reference a plug-in name.

trans-unit.source: In the test parameter, use {{plug-in name}}.
trans-unit.target: In the test parameter, use {{plug-in name}}.

trans-unit.source: Now, upload your test to the portal.
trans-unit.target: Now, upload your test to the portal.

trans-unit.source: It will use the dynamic values on every run of the test.
trans-unit.target: It will use the dynamic values on every run of the test.

trans-unit.source: Edit or disable a test
trans-unit.target: Edit or disable a test

trans-unit.source: Open an individual test to edit or disable it.
trans-unit.target: Open an individual test to edit or disable it.

trans-unit.source: Edit or disable a web test
trans-unit.target: Edit or disable a web test

trans-unit.source: You might want to disable web tests while you are performing maintenance on your service.
trans-unit.target: You might want to disable web tests while you are performing maintenance on your service.

trans-unit.source: Questions?
trans-unit.target: Questions?

trans-unit.source: Problems?
trans-unit.target: Problems?

trans-unit.source: Is there a difference between "web tests" and "availability"?
trans-unit.target: Is there a difference between "web tests" and "availability"?

trans-unit.source: We use the two terms interchangeably.
trans-unit.target: We use the two terms interchangeably.

trans-unit.source: Can I call code from my web test?
trans-unit.target: Can I call code from my web test?

trans-unit.source: No.
trans-unit.target: No.

trans-unit.source: The steps of the test must be in the .webtest file.
trans-unit.target: The steps of the test must be in the .webtest file.

trans-unit.source: Video
trans-unit.target: Video

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: [Search diagnostic logs][diagnostic]
trans-unit.target: [Search diagnostic logs][diagnostic]

trans-unit.source: [Troubleshooting][qna]
trans-unit.target: [Troubleshooting][qna]

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
